pros: Amazing staff, great training, right near the luas, good restaurant for staff
cons: None to mention as of right now

pros: Settled professional environment, pay formerly good, now racing to the bottom. Pension contribution scheme, good.
cons:
Pay and conditions for front-line staff is declining. OT department is not a great place to work IMO with management alternating between laissez-faire and autocratic.  Bullying is normalised and unchecked. 
Staff meals(on 12 hour shifts) have disimproved since subbed-out to outside contractors.  No career development or progression at this level. 
Join the union.

pros: Colleagues are pleasant, location is nice, canteen, gym etc
cons: Administration manager is weak in her role, not alot of training or promotion offered.

pros: Good annual leave allowances and salary. Individual managers are very good and considerate
staff have worked there for years and are good people who really care about the hospital
cons: Some of the managers have no integrity and cannot be trusted.

review_title: Good for short term prospects but not for the long term
pros: Facilities, transport to work, good MDT team co-operation .
cons: Too much emphasis on the input of poor management from external departments who do not understand individual roles and thus are allowed introduce policies and rules that are not relevant or overly disciplinary in their manner towards other staff manners leading to poor staff morale and a high staff turnover. Also, very poor for career progression and negativity towards flexible working conditions for those with families

pros: Location, nursing staff, IT support system
cons: Not enough staff, poor or unclear procedures, senior medical staff unavailable for consultation even when they are on call. Helpline is unmanned at the weekends increasing build up of queries. Walk in patients coming in unexpectedly even though Covid 19 is raging through the hospitals and high risk of exposure. Pressure on staff to take walk in patients even though risk to current patients in the hospital.

review_title: Not what it said on the tin
pros: Majority of people on the team, approachable and helpful. 35 hours per week
cons: The job description had no resemblance at all to the actual job.

job_title: Junior Human Resources Administrator in Dublin, Dublin
pros: St.Pats was my first HR role straight from college. I really enjoyed working here. It was a lovely role as i was able to get a feel for what my future in HR would be like. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful.
cons: I don't have any cons to working here

pros: Ability to work with and help lots of people and to progress in your role.  Good training opportunities
cons: Run like a business, medical model dominates.
Role strain, lack of boundaries of work
